definition: eyes bright and full of expression
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: He is an elderly gentleman, silver-haired, with a twinkle in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位上了年紀的紳士，滿頭銀髮，兩眼炯炯有神。

sentences.english: Her eyes had remain young and vivacious .
sentences.chinese: 她的眼睛非常年輕，炯炯有神。

sentences.english: He must remain sober-minded, bright and piercing eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他必須頭腦清醒，目光炯炯有神。

sentences.english: He was a youny man, bright of eye and quick of movement.
sentences.chinese: 他是個青年人，目光炯炯有神，行動敏捷。

sentences.english: You had a black eye. A right bloody shiner.
sentences.chinese: 你有一雙黑色的眼睛，炯炯有神。

sentences.english: He has a pair of bright piercing eyes.

definition: in glowing spirits (idiom); bursting with life/radiating health and vigor
red phoenix eyes (eyes whose outer corners incline upwards)
sharp image/clear-cut/in bold outline/in sharp relief
to have an imposing or impressive appearance/impressive appearance/straight and impressive looking
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
elegant, almond-shaped eyes with the inner canthus pointing down and the outer canthus up, like the eye of a phoenix
